snippet: The magazine publisher, once a towering presence in its industry, faces a shifting market with debts to pay as it begins trading Monday as an independent company.
abstract: Time Inc, once a towering presence in the magazine industry, prepares for an uncertain future following spinoff from Time Warner; will begin trading as an independent company as it wrestles with $1.3 billion in debt and a market that scorns print business as a thing of the past; investor confidence nonetheless remains somewhat warm, with pre-spinoff price rising to $23.48 from an initial price of $20.75.

byline.original: By DAVID CARR and RAVI SOMAIYA

lead_paragraph: The magazine publisher, once a towering presence in its industry, faces a shifting market with debts to pay as it begins trading Monday as an independent company.

headline.main: Time Inc. to Set a Lonely Course After a Spinoff
headline.print_headline: Time Inc. to Set Lonely Course After a Spinoff
